Class oracle.html.ImageMapArea

Class oracle.html.ImageMapArea 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.ImageMapArea
public class ImageMapArea
extends Object
implements IHtmlItem
Description:

The ImageMapArea class encapsulates an area element in a client side image map. Note that this is not part of standard HTML yet.

Example: 

// Create a new ImageMap (named "map1")
ImageMap map = new ImageMap("map1");
// Specify a circular region which, when clicked, will lead to "index.html"
map.addArea(new ImageMapArea("CIRCLE", "107,153,80", "index.html"));
// Create a new Image object that uses ImageMap named "map1"
Image img = new Image(img,"alternative test",IVAlign.NONE, false, "#map1"));

See Also:
ImageMap, Image

ImageMapArea(String, String, String)
Creates a client side image map area object .

print()
toHTML()
toString()

ImageMapArea 
  public ImageMapArea(String shape,
                      String coords,
                      String href)
Creates a client side image map area object .
Parameters:
shape - the shape of this area (RECT, POLY, CIRCLE, or DEFAULT) (optional)
coords - the coordinates of this area
href - where a click in the area should lead (optinal)
